channel.title: St. Matthew's United Methodist Church
channel.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC
channel.description: Located in Madison, Mississippi, St. Matthew's UMC is a family of faith reaching out to share the life-changing love and grace of Jesus.
channel.itunes:keywords: methodist church, madison, ms, united methodist podcast

item.itunes:title: February 22, 2026 - Traditional - Hallowed Be Thy Name
item.title: February 22, 2026 - Traditional - Hallowed Be Thy Name
item.itunes:summary: As we begin looking at the Lord's Prayer in this season of Lent, we turn to Matthew 6:9-13. What does it mean to pray to Our Father, who art in Heaven? What does it mean for us to say that His name is Holy?
item.description: As we begin looking at the Lord's Prayer in this season of Lent, we turn to Matthew 6:9-13.  What does it mean to pray to Our Father, who art in Heaven?  What does it mean for us to say that His name is Holy?
item.content:encoded: As we begin looking at the Lord's Prayer in this season of Lent, we turn to Matthew 6:9-13.  What does it mean to pray to Our Father, who art in Heaven?  What does it mean for us to say that His name is Holy?
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: February 22, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Hallowed be Thy Name
item.title: February 22, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Hallowed be Thy Name
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from February 22, 2026, Mary Beth shares with us from the Lord's Prayer as found in Matthew 6: 9-13. What does it mean to say that God is Holy? And what does that mean for us?
item.description: In our INTERSECTION service from February 22, 2026, Mary Beth shares with us from the Lord's Prayer as found in Matthew 6: 9-13. What does it mean to say that God is Holy? And what does that mean for us?

item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: February 15, 2026 - Traditonal - Go to Church
item.title: February 15, 2026 - Traditonal - Go to Church
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from February 15, Andy shares with us from Hebrews 10: 19-15. He explains why he considers himself a moderate. A moderate is not someone who does not have real theological or political thoughts and opinions. They will not break relationships over those differences. This has been the historic reality of the United Methodist Church, and may it remain so

They will not break relationships over those differences.  This has been the historic reality of the United Methodist Church, and may it remain so

item.itunes:title: Febuary 15, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Where God Goes to Church
item.title: Febuary 15, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Where God Goes to Church
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from February 15, 2026, Steve shares with us from Hebrews 10: 19-25. May we always be the kind of church where we know that God is in our midst.

item.title: February 8, 2026 - Traditional - All In

item.itunes:title: February 8, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Pray
item.title: February 8, 2026 - INTERSECTION - Pray
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from February 8, 2026, Andy shares with us from Philippians 4:4-7. We have a God to whom we can take all things in prayer. As we seek Him in prayer, we find His love, grace, and mercy.

item.title: February 1, 2026 - INTERSECTION - The Living Word
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from February 1, 2026, Steve shares with us about the transformative power of God's living word!

item.itunes:title: February 1, 2026 - Traditional - Read Your Bible
item.title: February 1, 2026 - Traditional - Read Your Bible
item.itunes:summary: In our sermon from February 1, 2026, Andy shares with us from Colossians 3:16-17. We are supposed to marinate ourselves in God's Word, let it drench up every part of who we are. And when we do that, it will change how we live our very lives.
item.description: In our sermon from February 1, 2026, Andy shares with us from Colossians 3:16-17. We are supposed to marinate ourselves in God's Word, let it drench up every part of who we are.  And when we do that, it will change how we live our very lives.

item.itunes:title: January 25, 2026 - INTERSECTION - This is Eternal Life
item.title: January 25, 2026 - INTERSECTION - This is Eternal Life
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION sermon from January 25, 2026, Mary Beth shares with us from John 17: 1-3. We see that eternal life, at its core, is about knowing Jesus. And that is a love you can know right now.

item.itunes:title: January 25, 2026 - Traditional - This is Eternal Life
item.title: January 25, 2026 - Traditional - This is Eternal Life
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from January 25, 2026, Andy shares from John 17:1-3. Jesus tells us here what eternal life is: know Him. We experience it every day, and when Jesus is in the center of life together, we have unity.

item.itunes:title: January 18, 2026 - INTERSECTION - What We Are Made Of
item.title: January 18, 2026 - INTERSECTION - What We Are Made Of
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from January 18, 2026, Steve Casteel shares with uas about being salt and light. As we remember the "whys" of why we are here, we remember the importance of being salt and light.

item.itunes:title: January 18, 2026- Traditional - Leaving a Mark
item.title: January 18, 2026- Traditional - Leaving a Mark
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from January 19, 2026, Andy shares with us from Matthew 5: 13-16. We all want to leave a mark, we want to leave a legacy. By being salt and light, we see what a true legacy looks like.

item.itunes:title: January 4, 2026 - Traditional - Hidden Heroes
item.title: January 4, 2026 - Traditional - Hidden Heroes
item.itunes:summary: In our Epiphany Sunday message, Andy shares with us from Matthew 2: 1-12. We see the story of the Wise Men and their call to faithfulness above all else. May that be our goal for this new year!

item.title: December 28, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Praise the Lord
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from December 28, 2025, Brian shares with us from Psalm 148. Praise is the rhythm of our lives. How will we keep that rhythm in the year to come?

item.itunes:title: December 28, 2025 - Traditional - Praise the Lord
item.title: December 28, 2025 - Traditional - Praise the Lord
item.itunes:summary: In our final sermon of the year for 2025, Andy looks at Psalm 148. We see the importance of praise to our lives; it is the metronome, it keeps the rhythm and beat to our lives. Where was that rhythm of praise in 2025? Where will you keep it in 2026?

item.itunes:title: December 21, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Love
item.title: December 21, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Love
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from December 21, 2025, Brian shares with us from Matthew 1: 18-25. In Joseph's story, we see what love really looks like.

item.itunes:title: December 21, 2025 - Traditional - Love
item.title: December 21, 2025 - Traditional - Love
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from December 21, 2025, Andy look Matthew 1: 18-25. We see in Joseph's story that love is not merely an emotion that we feel, but love is simple, kind, sacrificial actions. Love is not what we feel; it is what we do.

item.itunes:title: December 7, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Peace
item.title: December 7, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Peace
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from December 7, 2025, Brian looks at Matthew 3: 1-12. We see John the Baptist's call for repentance. That gift of repentance leads us to peace.

item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from December 7, 2025, Andy shares with us from Matthew 3: 1-12. Repentance is a gift, because repentance reminds us just how much God loves us and longs to forgive us.

item.itunes:title: November 30 2025 - Traditional - Hope
item.title: November 30 2025 - Traditional - Hope
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from the first Sunday of Advent, we look at Matthew 24, 36 44 we look at the hope that comes from Jesus' second coming. We heard this passage with fear, but that is not the intent. He is not coming to get us, He is coming to save us!
item.description: In our Traditional message from the first Sunday of Advent, we look at Matthew 24, 36 44 we look at the hope that comes from Jesus' second coming. We heard this passage with fear, but that is not the intent.  He is not coming to get us, He is coming to save us!

item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: November 30, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Hope
item.title: November 30, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Hope
item.itunes:summary: In our message for the first Sunday of Advent, Brian and Mary Beth remind us that our hope is in Jesus' coming. He is coming to save us!

item.itunes:title: November 23, 2025 - INTERSECTION - King of the Middle
item.title: November 23, 2025 - INTERSECTION - King of the Middle
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service, Mary Beth preaches from Luke 23: 33-43. We see Jesus upon the cross, and see His call to love, even those who may be different from us. He is Lord, and He loves us. He calls us to do the same, love all we meet. His Lordship pushes us away from the edges of our society, but to the middle, where we smash idols and love all.
item.description: In our INTERSECTION service, Mary Beth preaches from Luke 23: 33-43.  We see Jesus upon the cross, and see His call to love, even those who may be different from us. He is Lord, and He loves us. He calls us to do the same, love all we meet.  His Lordship pushes us away from the edges of our society, but to the middle, where we smash idols and love all.
item.content:encoded: In our INTERSECTION service, Mary Beth preaches from Luke 23: 33-43.  We see Jesus upon the cross, and see His call to love, even those who may be different from us. He is Lord, and He loves us. He calls us to do the same, love all we meet.  His Lordship pushes us away from the edges of our society, but to the middle, where we smash idols and love all.
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: November 23, 2025 - Traditional - Speaking Our Language
item.title: November 23, 2025 - Traditional - Speaking Our Language
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon for November 23, 2025, Christ the King Sunday, we look at what it means to say that Christ is King? His kingship is not like the earthly, human kings, but His kingship is found in His wounds. He inhabits our praise, but He also inhabits our suffering and hurts. Jesus, alone, is King!
item.description: In our Traditional sermon for November 23, 2025, Christ the King Sunday, we look at what it means to say that Christ is King?  His kingship is not like the earthly, human kings, but His kingship is found in His wounds. He inhabits our praise, but He also inhabits our suffering and hurts.  Jesus, alone, is King!
item.content:encoded: In our Traditional sermon for November 23, 2025, Christ the King Sunday, we look at what it means to say that Christ is King?  His kingship is not like the earthly, human kings, but His kingship is found in His wounds. He inhabits our praise, but He also inhabits our suffering and hurts.  Jesus, alone, is King!
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: November 16, 2025 - Confirmation Sunday - All Things New
item.title: November 16, 2025 - Confirmation Sunday - All Things New
item.itunes:summary: In our Confirmation message from November 16, 2025, Mary Beth Ashely Davis shares with us from Isaiah 65: 1-5. God is making all things new, including us. This isn't a future hope, but a present reality!

item.itunes:title: October 26, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Son of Encouragement
item.title: October 26, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Son of Encouragement
item.itunes:summary: Barnabas is called the Son of Encouragement because he believes in what others can be through Jesus. We need people who believe in what we can be, and what we are doing, through the power of the Holy Spirit. We need sons and daughters of encouragement!
item.description: Barnabas is called the Son of Encouragement because he believes in what others can be through Jesus. We need people who believe in what we can be, and what we are doing, through the power of the Holy Spirit. We need sons and daughters of encouragement!

item.itunes:title: October 19, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Look Around
item.title: October 19, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Look Around
item.itunes:summary: We see in Luke 8: 1-3 that Mary and the other women supported Jesus' ministry. They were thankful for what He had done for them. That thanking should be our motivation as well!
item.description: We see in Luke 8: 1-3 that Mary and the other women supported Jesus' ministry. They were thankful for what He had done for them. That thanking should be our motivation as well!

item.itunes:title: October 19, 2025 - Traditional - Look Around
item.title: October 19, 2025 - Traditional - Look Around
item.itunes:summary: In our sermon from October 19, Andy shares with us from Luke 8 1-3. We see how Mary and the other women gave to Jesus because they were thankful. Jesus has done so much for us; He deserves all that we can give Him.

item.itunes:title: October 12, 2025- INTERSECTION - The More You Know
item.title: October 12, 2025- INTERSECTION - The More You Know
item.itunes:summary: In our message from October 12, 2025, Andy shares with us from Genesis 14:17-24. Where does tithing come from? Why is it important? We see Abram gives 10% of what he has to Melkizedek, the first tithe in scripture.

item.itunes:title: October 12, 2025- Traditional - The More You Know
item.title: October 12, 2025- Traditional - The More You Know
item.itunes:summary: In our message from October 12, 2025, Andy shares with us from Genesis 14:17-24. Where does tithing come from? Why is it important? We see Abram gives 10% of what he has to Melkizedek, who is a spiritual forerunner to Jesus (Psalm 110, Hebrews 7). He had a vision for what God was doing. It is the same for us. That is why we give.
item.description: In our message from October 12, 2025, Andy shares with us from Genesis 14:17-24.  Where does tithing come from? Why is it important? We see Abram gives 10% of what he has to Melkizedek, who is a spiritual forerunner to Jesus (Psalm 110, Hebrews 7).  He had a vision for what God was doing. It is the same for us. That is why we give.

That is why we give.

item.itunes:title: October 5, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Use of Money
item.title: October 5, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Use of Money
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION sermon from October 5, 2025, Brian shares with us from 1 Timothy 6:3-10. We are reminded of Wesley's call to the first Methodists—to earn all you can, save all you can, and give all you can.

item.itunes:title: October 5, 2025 - Traditional - On the Use of Money
item.title: October 5, 2025 - Traditional - On the Use of Money
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from October 5, 2025, Andy shares with us from 1 Timothy 6:3-10. Wesley told the early Methodists to "earn all you can, save all you can, and give all you can." Our budget is our greatest theological statement.

item.itunes:title: September 28, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Sanctifying Grace
item.title: September 28, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Sanctifying Grace
item.itunes:summary: In our final message on the Scripture Way of Salvation, Brian shares with us, from Mark, Jesus's greatest commandment to us, to love God and neighbor. This is what sanctification truly looks like!
item.description: In our final message on the Scripture Way of Salvation, Brian shares with us, from Mark, Jesus's greatest commandment to us, to love God and neighbor. This is what sanctification truly looks like!

item.itunes:title: September 28, 2025 - Traditional - Scripture Way of Salvation: Sanctifying Grace
item.title: September 28, 2025 - Traditional - Scripture Way of Salvation: Sanctifying Grace
item.itunes:summary: Our sermon got dropped today. Andy gives us a quick recap of the sermon. We see that holiness is love when God sanctifies us through His grace, we are able to love, forgive, and extend mercy. In a cold world, that shows the effect Jesus has on our lives!
item.description: Our sermon got dropped today. Andy gives us a quick recap of the sermon. We see that holiness is love when God sanctifies us through His grace, we are able to love, forgive, and extend mercy. In a cold world, that shows the effect Jesus has on our lives!

item.itunes:title: September 21, 2025 - Traditional - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Justifying Grace
item.title: September 21, 2025 - Traditional - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Justifying Grace
item.itunes:summary: As part of our series "The Scripture Way of Salvation," we look at Justifying Grace. This form of grace is what we see in "getting saved," or a "profession of faith," or "conversion." This is when we walk through the door and enter the house, when we truly follow Jesus. And this step is all about grace!
item.description: As part of our series "The Scripture Way of Salvation," we look at Justifying Grace. item.title: Septemer 14, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Prevenient Grace
item.itunes:summary: In our series on Wesley's understanding of Salvation, "The Scripture Way of Salvation," we talk about Prevenient Grace, the grace that goes before our conversion. God is always seeking us, calling us, saving us

item.itunes:title: September 14, 2025 - Traditional - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Prevenient Grace
item.title: September 14, 2025 - Traditional - The Scripture Way of Salvation: Prevenient Grace
item.itunes:summary: In our series on Wesley's understanding of Salvation, "The Scripture Way of Salvation," we talk about Prevenient Grace, the grace that goes before our conversion. God is always seeking us, calling us, saving us. He doesn't love us because we are perfect. He loves us because He is perfect.

item.itunes:title: September 7, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Alls
item.title: September 7, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Alls
item.itunes:summary: This month, we will be looking at what it is that United Methodists believe about salvation. We'll look at what Wesley called "The Scripture Way of Salvation." We begin this series with these key points - all are made in the image of God, all need Jesus, all can be saved, and all can be saved to the uttermost!
item.description: This month, we will be looking at what it is that United Methodists believe about salvation. We'll look at what Wesley called "The Scripture Way of Salvation." We begin this series with these key points - all are made in the image of God, all need Jesus, all can be saved, and all can be saved to the uttermost!

item.itunes:title: August 31, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Calm in the Storm
item.title: August 31, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Calm in the Storm
item.itunes:summary: Brian shares with us from Matthew 8: 23-27. We see Jesus calm the storm, and we know that no matter the storm in our lives, Jesus can calm it and bring life.
item.description: Brian shares with us from Matthew 8: 23-27. We see Jesus calm the storm, and we know that no matter the storm in our lives, Jesus can calm it and bring life.

item.itunes:title: August 31, 2025 - Traditional - Calm in the Storm
item.title: August 31, 2025 - Traditional - Calm in the Storm
item.itunes:summary: In our final sermon from our Three Simple Rules series, we look at Matthew 8:23-27. We see Jesus calm the storm. Where in our lives do we find God? Build your life around that, and no matter the storm, we will find life.

item.itunes:title: August 24, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Say in Love with God
item.title: August 24, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Say in Love with God
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message, Brian shares with us the importance of our spiritual disciplines and the difference they can make in our faith!

item.itunes:title: August 24, 2025 - Traditional - Stay in Love with God
item.title: August 24, 2025 - Traditional - Stay in Love with God
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from August 24, 2025, Andy shares with us from Philippians 2 12-13. We are called to place ourselves in a position to experience God, and then God will do the rest. In our disciples, we are faithful, but God does the work!

item.itunes:title: August 17, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Do Good
item.title: August 17, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Do Good
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our series "Three Simple Rules" we take time to talk about how doing good makes a real difference in our lives and in the life of the world.

item.itunes:title: August 17, 2025 - Traditional - Do Good
item.title: August 17, 2025 - Traditional - Do Good
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our series "Three Simple Rules," we look at what it means to do good. How do our simple acts of goodness make a real difference in the world? How do they help us build our lives around Jesus?

item.itunes:title: August 10, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Do No Harm
item.title: August 10, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Do No Harm
item.itunes:summary: As we continue looking at Wesley's Rules for the Methodists, we look at his first rule for us to live by, Do No Harm. In our divided world, often doing no harm is the first best thing we can do!
item.description: As we continue looking at Wesley's Rules for the Methodists, we look at his first rule for us to live by, Do No Harm. In our divided world, often doing no harm is the first best thing we can do!

item.itunes:title: August 10, 2025 - Traditional - Do No Harm
item.title: August 10, 2025 - Traditional - Do No Harm
item.itunes:summary: As we continue in our series "Three Simple Rules," we examine Wesley's call to the early Methodists to "Do No Harm." We may not always know the right thing to say, but we generally know what not to do. Sometimes the first step of healing is to avoid doing harm.

item.itunes:title: August 3, 2025 - INTERSECTION - A Rule?
item.title: August 3, 2025 - INTERSECTION - A Rule?
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION sermon for August 3, 2025 Brian shares with us how we can better build our lives around what God is doing in our lives in this new school year!

item.itunes:title: August 3, 2025 - Traditional - A Rule?
item.title: August 3, 2025 - Traditional - A Rule?
item.itunes:summary: As we start our new series in August, talking about the "Three Simple Rules," we take time to talk about what it means to have a rule. We look at Deuteronomy 6:1-8 and talk about how it is, in the busyness of our lives, we build our lives around God.

item.itunes:title: July 27, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with John the Revelator
item.title: July 27, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with John the Revelator
item.itunes:summary: In the last of our summer sermon series, we take a road trip with John the Revelator. Take a moment to learn what this last book of the Bible teaches us!

item.itunes:title: July 27, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with John the Revelator
item.title: July 27, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with John the Revelator
item.itunes:summary: In our last series from our summer "Road Trip" series, we look at John the Revelator. While this book can be, and is, confusing, this book reminds us of this central truth. God wins! We are a people of hope!

item.itunes:title: July 13, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with Priscilla and Aquila
item.title: July 13, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with Priscilla and Aquila
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION sermon from July 13, Brian shares with us the story of Priscilla and Aquila. We see in their lives the power of welcome and hospitality.

item.title: July 13, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Priscilla and Aquila
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from July 13, Andy shares with us the story of Priscilla and Aquila. We see in their lives the power of welcome and hospitality. Their love changed Apollo's life and, through that, so many others!

item.itunes:title: June 22, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Deborah
item.title: June 22, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Deborah
item.itunes:summary: In our Road Trip Series, we look at Deborah, this great female judge and leader of the people. Her story, and all the book of Judges, shows how God will use unexpected people, like "them" and like us.

item.itunes:title: June 22, 2025- INTERSECTION - On the Road with Deborah
item.title: June 22, 2025- INTERSECTION - On the Road with Deborah
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from June 22, we look closer at the life of Deborah. This judge was an unexpected person whom God uses. God uses all kinds of wonderfully unexpected people!

item.itunes:title: June 15, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Joseph
item.title: June 15, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Joseph
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from June 15, 2025, Andy shares with us from Matthew 2: 13-23. Joseph had plans for his life, good plans, but God came and upended all of these. Even though Joseph may not have understood it completely at first, he remained faithful. That's our call. Not perfection. Faithfulness.
item.description: In our Traditional message from June 15, 2025, Andy shares with us from Matthew 2: 13-23.  Joseph had plans for his life, good plans, but God came and upended all of these. Even though Joseph may not have understood it completely at first, he remained faithful. That's our call. Not perfection. Faithfulness.

item.itunes:title: June 15, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with Joseph
item.title: June 15, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with Joseph
item.itunes:summary: In our "Road Trip" series, Brian shares with us from Matthew 2: 13-23. We look at Joseph and how he was faithful to God, even when he was unsure. He trusted in God, even when it didn't always make sense!

item.itunes:title: INTERSECTION - On the Road with the Church
item.title: INTERSECTION - On the Road with the Church
item.itunes:summary: In our Pentecost sermon, we read from Acts 21:1-21. We see that on this day, the Spirit was given to us. The church was born, but within that, the hope of Glory is Christ with us. We each have the Spirit, and we are called to that Good News of Jesus Christ with us outside the walls, into all the world!

item.itunes:title: June 1, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Abraham
item.title: June 1, 2025 - Traditional - On the Road with Abraham
item.itunes:summary: Our VBS will explore different Road Trips in Scripture, so throughout the summer, in our sermons, we will examine various individuals who traveled with God. Today, we'll look at Abraham and the road trip of faith that takes us, with all of our faithfulness and faults.

item.title: June 1, 2025 - INTERSECTION - On the Road with Abraham
item.itunes:summary: Our VBS will explore different Road Trips in Scripture, so throughout the summer, in our sermons, we will examine various individuals who traveled with God. Today, we'll look at Abraham and the road trip of faith that takes us, with all of our faithfulness and faults.

item.itunes:title: May 18, 2025 - Traditional - A Harvest
item.title: May 18, 2025 - Traditional - A Harvest
item.itunes:summary: In our Sunday sermon from May 18, 2025, Andy shares with us from Acts 11 1-18, the Lord pushes Peter to be uncomfortable, and to love people that can be hard to love. Let us not look at the world and see enemies where the Lord sees a harvest.

item.itunes:title: May 11, 2025 - Baccalaureate Service - Living Water for the Wounded
item.title: May 11, 2025 - Baccalaureate Service - Living Water for the Wounded
item.itunes:summary: In our Baccalaureate Service sermon, Mary Beth shares with us from John 4. In His conversation with the Samaritan woman at the well, we see Jesus look past labels and see her. And love her. Jesus offers us grace, which, like water, flows to the broken places of our lives.
item.description: In our Baccalaureate Service sermon, Mary Beth shares with us from John 4. In His conversation with the Samaritan woman at the well, we see Jesus look past labels and see her. And love her.  Jesus offers us grace, which, like water, flows to the broken places of our lives.

item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: May 4, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Most Important Questions
item.title: May 4, 2025 - INTERSECTION - The Most Important Questions
item.itunes:summary: Come to the table: Just like the day on the seashore, Jesus is waiting to meet you. Jesus has answers for your questions. He has questions for you. He is waiting. He wants you to follow him and feed his sheep.
item.description: Come to the table: Just like the day on the seashore, Jesus is waiting to meet you. Jesus has answers for your questions. He has questions for you. He is waiting. He wants you to follow him and feed his sheep.

item.itunes:title: May 4, 2025 - Traditional - Calling Your Name
item.title: May 4, 2025 - Traditional - Calling Your Name
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from May 4, 2025, Andy shares with us from John 21: 1-19. We see Jesus restore Peter. He forgives Peter's sin and restores him. He calls Peter by his name. Today, Jesus will restore. Listen for Him calling your name.
item.description: In our Traditional message from May 4, 2025, Andy shares with us from John 21: 1-19. We see Jesus restore Peter. He forgives Peter's sin and restores him.  He calls Peter by his name. Today, Jesus will restore. Listen for Him calling your name.

item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: April 27, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Why Are You Afraid?
item.title: April 27, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Why Are You Afraid?
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from April 27, 2025, Mary Beth looks at John 20 19-31. We see Thomas and his doubts, but we also see the disciples and their fear. Why are you afraid?
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from April 27, 2025, Mary Beth looks at John 20 19-31. We see Thomas and his doubts, but we also see the disciples and their fear. Why are you afraid?

item.itunes:title: April 27, 2025 - Traditional - Why Are You Afraid?
item.title: April 27, 2025 - Traditional - Why Are You Afraid?
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from April 27, Brian shares with us from John 20: 19-31. We see the story of Thomas and his doubts, but this is, more importantly, a story of fear. Today, even in light of the resurrection, what are you afraid of?

item.itunes:title: April 20. 2025 - INTERSECTION - Easter - He is Risen
item.title: April 20. 2025 - INTERSECTION - Easter - He is Risen
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION Easter message, Brian shares with us from John 20: 1-18. We as Christians have our great hope, because of Easter. He is risen!
item.description: In our INTERSECTION Easter message, Brian shares with us from John 20: 1-18.  We as Christians have our great hope, because of Easter. He is risen!
item.content:encoded: In our INTERSECTION Easter message, Brian shares with us from John 20: 1-18.  We as Christians have our great hope, because of Easter. He is risen!
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: April 20, 2025 - Traditional - Easter - Tell the Story
item.title: April 20, 2025 - Traditional - Easter - Tell the Story
item.itunes:summary: In our Easter sermon from our Traditional service, Andy looks at the story of John, Peter, and Mary, and how they came to believe in the resurrection. We don't need any gimmicks. We have the greatest story of all time, as Christians. He is Risen! He is risen indeed!
item.description: In our Easter sermon from our Traditional service, Andy looks at the story of John, Peter, and Mary, and how they came to believe in the resurrection. We don't need any gimmicks. We have the greatest story of all time, as Christians. He is Risen!  He is risen indeed!

item.itunes:title: April 18, 2025 - Good Friday - On the Cross
item.title: April 18, 2025 - Good Friday - On the Cross
item.itunes:summary: In our Good Friday message, Brian shares with us the true power of the cross.

item.itunes:title: April 17, 2025 - Maundy Thursday - In the End
item.title: April 17, 2025 - Maundy Thursday - In the End
item.itunes:summary: In our Maundy Thursday service, Andy preaches from John 13. Before He goes to the cross, Jesus leaves with His disciples, and each of us, three things. An example of service. The promise of presence. And a new command.
item.description: In our Maundy Thursday service, Andy preaches from John 13. Before He goes to the cross, Jesus leaves with His disciples, and each of us, three things. An example of service. The promise of presence. And a new command.

item.itunes:title: April 16, 2025 - Holy Wednesday
item.title: April 16, 2025 - Holy Wednesday
item.itunes:summary: In our Holy Wednesday Message from our combined service with St. Columb's Episcopal Church, Rev. Dr. Natalie Houghtby-Haddon shares about Jesus's all-embracing love, which takes in Peter, Judas, and even each of us.

item.itunes:title: April 13, 2025 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Can You Feel It?
item.title: April 13, 2025 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Can You Feel It?
item.itunes:summary: In our traditional Palm Sunday message, Andy shares with us from Luke 19: 28-40. On this Palm Sunday, we see Jesus enter Jerusalem. The energy is eclectic. But the next step for everyone is always the hardest step.

item.itunes:title: April 13, 2025 - Palm Suday - INTERSECTION - Radical Faith
item.title: April 13, 2025 - Palm Suday - INTERSECTION - Radical Faith
item.itunes:summary: We welcome our guest preacher, our incoming District Superintendent, the Rev. Trey Haper, to share with us on Palm Sunday from Luke 19: 28-40. Jesus's entry into Jerusalem changed everything.

item.itunes:title: April 6, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Consequences and Hope
item.title: April 6, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Consequences and Hope
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from April 6, 2025, Brian shares with us from 1 Corinthians 15: 20-22. We are reminded that our sins have consequences, but we always have hope in Jesus.
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from April 6, 2025, Brian shares with us from 1 Corinthians 15: 20-22. We are reminded that our sins have consequences, but we always have hope in Jesus.

item.itunes:title: April 6, 2025 - Traditional - Consequences and Hope
item.title: April 6, 2025 - Traditional - Consequences and Hope
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from April 6, 2025, Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 15: 20-22. All are dead through Adam, but through Christ, all can live. We are more than our failures. We can live because of Jesus!

item.itunes:title: March 30, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's Last Temptation
item.title: March 30, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's Last Temptation
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from March 30, 2025, Brian shares with us from Matthew 4: 1-11. We see Jesus be tempted to worship someone other than God. What do we learn from this for our own lives?
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from March 30, 2025, Brian shares with us from Matthew 4: 1-11. We see Jesus be tempted to worship someone other than God. What do we learn from this for our own lives?

item.itunes:title: March 30, 2025 - Traditional - Jesus's Third Temptation
item.title: March 30, 2025 - Traditional - Jesus's Third Temptation
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from March 30, 2023, we look at Jesus's third temptation. This one cuts the heart of all other temptations. Who are we? Where does our allegiance lie? We also learn this truth - temptation is always a lie.
item.description: In our Traditional message from March 30, 2023, we look at Jesus's third temptation. This one cuts the heart of all other temptations.  Who are we? Where does our allegiance lie? We also learn this truth - temptation is always a lie.

item.itunes:title: March 23, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's Second Temptation
item.title: March 23, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's Second Temptation
item.itunes:summary: We return again to Matthew 4: 1-11 as we look at Jesus's temptation. In our INTERSECTION service from March 23, 2025, Andy shares with us the great choice for Jesus. Would He trust the Father to take care of Him? We face the same choice today.
item.description: We return again to Matthew 4: 1-11 as we look at Jesus's temptation.  In our INTERSECTION service from March 23, 2025, Andy shares with us the great choice for Jesus. Would He trust the Father to take care of Him? We face the same choice today.

item.itunes:title: March 23, 2025 - Traditional - Jesus's Second Temptation
item.title: March 23, 2025 - Traditional - Jesus's Second Temptation
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from March 23, 2025, Brian shares with us from Matthew 4: 1-11. We see Jesus wrestle with this temptation: does He really trust the Father to take care of Him?
item.description: In our Traditional message from March 23, 2025, Brian shares with us from Matthew 4: 1-11. We see Jesus wrestle with this temptation: does He really trust the Father to take care of Him?

item.itunes:title: March 16, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's First Temptation
item.title: March 16, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Jesus's First Temptation
item.itunes:summary: Over the next few weeks, we'll look more closely at Jesus's temptation. Today, we look at the first of His three temptations, turning stone into bread. What is the temptation here? What is happening in this text?

item.itunes:title: March 16, 2025 - Traditional: Jesus's First Temptation
item.title: March 16, 2025 - Traditional: Jesus's First Temptation
item.itunes:summary: Over the next three Sundays, we will examine Jesus's temptations more closely, each individually. Today, we examine the temptation to turn stones into bread. What was happening here? What is this temptation actually about?
item.description: Over the next three Sundays, we will examine Jesus's temptations more closely, each individually. Today, we examine the temptation to turn stones into bread. What was happening here? What is this temptation actually about?

item.itunes:title: March 9, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Not Overcome
item.title: March 9, 2025 - INTERSECTION - Not Overcome
item.itunes:summary: In the opening sermon for our Lenten series on Temptation, Brian shares with us from 1 Corinthians 10: 11-13. We are not overcome by our temptation! Jesus is with us!
item.description: In the opening sermon for our Lenten series on Temptation, Brian shares with us from 1 Corinthians 10: 11-13. We are not overcome by our temptation!  Jesus is with us!

item.itunes:title: March 9, 2025 - Traditional - Not Overcome
item.title: March 9, 2025 - Traditional - Not Overcome
item.itunes:summary: In the first sermon in our Lenten series "Temptation," Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 10: 11-13. We see how no temptations have ever come upon us that have not been faced before. We are not overcome by temptation, and Jesus shows us the way out!
item.description: In the first sermon in our Lenten series "Temptation," Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 10: 11-13.  We see how no temptations have ever come upon us that have not been faced before. We are not overcome by temptation, and Jesus shows us the way out!

item.itunes:title: March 5, 2025 - Ash Wednesday - In Secret
item.title: March 5, 2025 - Ash Wednesday - In Secret
item.itunes:summary: In our Ash Wednesday Sermon from March 5, 2025, we look at Matthew 6: 1-6; 16-21. Jesus tells His followers that when they fast and pray, they should do so in secret. During this Lenten season, may we spend time in secret, giving Jesus the room He needs to draw us close.
item.description: In our Ash Wednesday Sermon from March 5, 2025, we look at Matthew 6: 1-6; 16-21. Jesus tells His followers that when they fast and pray, they should do so in secret. During this Lenten season, may we spend time in secret, giving Jesus the room He needs to draw us close.

item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: March 2, 2025 - Traditional - I Am the Vine
item.title: March 2, 2025 - Traditional - I Am the Vine
item.itunes:summary: In the last sermon in our "I Am" series, Andy shares with us from John 15:1-5. Here, we see Jesus tell us that He is the vine. But, he also tells us this: we are the branches. And for us to live, we must abide, or be rooted, in Him, and Him alone.
item.description: In the last sermon in our "I Am" series, Andy shares with us from John 15:1-5. Here, we see Jesus tell us that He is the vine. But, he also tells us this: we are the branches. And for us to live, we must abide, or be rooted, in Him, and Him alone.

item.title: February 23, 2025 - INTERSECTION - I Am the Way, the Truth, and the Life
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from February 23, 2025, we see Jesus's words where He tells us that "I AM the way, the truth, and the life." He is the way to the Father, and His life calls us to walk in the way that He walked.

item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional Message, Andy shares with us from John 8:12 and 9:5. As we continue our series "I Am," looking at the I Am statements of Jesus, we talk about what it means to say that Jesus is the Light of the World. How is He light in our lives and in the world?

item.itunes:title: January 26, 2025 - Combined Worship - What Now Shall We Do?

item.title: December 22, 2024 - Traditional - Come Home

item.itunes:title: December 1, 2024 - Traditional - Lift Up Your Heads
item.title: December 1, 2024 - Traditional - Lift Up Your Heads
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from the First Sudnay of Advent, Andy shares with us from Luke 21: 25-36. We see Jesus telling us to be prepared. Look up. In this world of gray, look for green. Keep your heads up. Hope is always coming!

item.itunes:title: November 24, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Christ the King
item.title: November 24, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Christ the King
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message, Brian shares with us from John 18: 33-37. Jesus is king! His kingdom is not of this world, but in this world we can have hope!
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message, Brian shares with us from John 18: 33-37. Jesus is king!  His kingdom is not of this world, but in this world we can have hope!

item.itunes:title: November 24, 2024 - Traditional - Not of this World
item.title: November 24, 2024 - Traditional - Not of this World
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from November 24, 2024, Andy shares with us from John 18: 33-37. We see here that Pilate didn't know what to do with Jesus because Jesus knew His kingdom was not of this world. We live with hope because we have a great home. Jesus is king. Rejoice!

item.title: November 17, 2024 - Traditional - Our People

item.title: November 10, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Our Daily Bread
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service, Brian shares with us from Mark 12: 38-44. We see in the story of the widow's mite the power of sacrifice and faithfulness.

item.itunes:title: November 10, 2024 - Traditional - Our Daily Bread
item.title: November 10, 2024 - Traditional - Our Daily Bread
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from November 10, 2024, Andy looks at Mark 12: 38-44. We see that the widow gives sacrificially. While this is hard, giving, sacrificing, and following Jesus, is always a challenge. But it is always where life is found.

item.title: November 3, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Home
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from All Saints Sunday, Brian shares with us from Revelation 21: 1-6. One day, through God's grace, we will all be home.

item.itunes:title: November 3, 2024 - Traditional - Home
item.title: November 3, 2024 - Traditional - Home
item.itunes:summary: In our All Saints Sunday sermon, Andy shares with us from Revelation 21:1-6. We are heading home. We aren't yet there, but God is taking us to better place. We rejoice for our saints who are already there. But we know we are going home.

item.itunes:title: October 27, 2024 - Tradition - Abundant Commitment
item.title: October 27, 2024 - Tradition - Abundant Commitment
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from October 27, 2024, Andy preaches from John 12: 20-26. As a church, we have everything we need to be faithful to the great calling that God has given us. We have an abundant commitment here to move from scarcity to abundance.

item.itunes:title: October 20, 2024 - Traditional - Abundant Resources
item.title: October 20, 2024 - Traditional - Abundant Resources
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from October 20, 2024, Andy preaches from 2 Kings 4: 1-7. We talk about God's abundance and how we have all that we need, here, right here, to be faithful to God's call.

item.title: October 6, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Abundance
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from October 6, Brian shares with us from John 10:10. God is going to give us grace to serve in abundant ways!

item.itunes:title: October 6, 2024 - Traditional - Abundance
item.title: October 6, 2024 - Traditional - Abundance
item.itunes:summary: In our October 6, 2024 sermon, Andy shared with us from John 10:10. As a church, we are on the verge of something supernatural—something huge. Our world needs what St. Matthew's offers. God has something big in store, and He will give us all that we need to accomplish that task. We are moving from scarcity to abundance.

item.title: September 22, 2024 - Traditional - Works of Mercy: Compassion
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from September 22, 2024, our Children's Sabbath, Andy shares with us from Matthew 25: 31-46. Jesus tells us to love the least of this. When we live out this compassion, especially in the hardest to love, it changes them, and it changes us.

item.itunes:title: September 8, 2024 - INTERSECTION - The Practices of the Church: The Works of Devotion
item.title: September 8, 2024 - INTERSECTION - The Practices of the Church: The Works of Devotion
item.itunes:summary: Today, as we continue our series The Practice of the Church, we look at the first of the Works of Piety, Devotion. This is loving God in a personal way. Why do we do this? Why does it matter? How does this help restore the new creation within us?

item.itunes:title: September 1, 2024 - Combined Worship - The Practice of the Church: The New Creation
item.title: September 1, 2024 - Combined Worship - The Practice of the Church: The New Creation
item.itunes:summary: In our Combined service on September 1, 2024, Andy shared 2 Corinthians 5: 16-21. The goal of our salvation is to restore the new creation within us. How do we do that? This month, we will discuss how the means of grace help restore that which sin has taken.

item.itunes:title: August 25, 2024 - INTERSECTION - The Mission of the Church: Our Community
item.title: August 25, 2024 - INTERSECTION - The Mission of the Church: Our Community
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message, Brian shares with us the story of David and Mephibosheth. We see the power of welcome, the power of David inviting someone to his table who should have been his enemy.

item.itunes:title: August 25, 2024 - Traditional - The Mission of the Church: Our Community
item.title: August 25, 2024 - Traditional - The Mission of the Church: Our Community
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message, Andy shares with us from 2 Samuel 9. We see the story of David and Mephibosheth, Saul's grandson. David should have killed him (according to the world), not welcomed him. Yet David brought him to the table. Our world needs community and welcome. Who can we bring to the table?

item.title: July 28, 2024 - Traditional - The Marks of the Church: Welcome
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to be a welcoming church? What does Jesus' Table look like? Who gets to come? We see today that Jesus loves and invites the entire world. That means we have to as well.

item.title: July 21, 2024 - INTERSECTION - The Marks of the Church: Evangelical
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from July 21, 2024 Brian shares with us from John 14: 5-6. We call ourselves evangelical. In a world where that label carries a lot, what does that mean?

item.itunes:title: July 21, 2024 - Traditional - The Marks of the Church: Evangelical
item.title: July 21, 2024 - Traditional - The Marks of the Church: Evangelical
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional service on July 21, 2024, Andy shared with us from John 14: 5-6. We are an evangelical church. That label is thrown around a lot in our world. What does it mean to say that Jesus is the way, the truth, and the life and that no one comes to the Father but through Him? Let's be careful to build our church only on the rock of Jesus.

item.title: July 7, 2024 - Traditional - The Marks of the Church: Orthodox
item.itunes:summary: In our July 7 sermon, we continue our series "The Marks of the Church." Orthodox or Orthodoxy is a word we hear tossed around a lot. It's an important word, and orthodox theology is one of the foundations of our church. But what exactly does that mean?

item.title: June 23, 2024 - Traditional - The Marks of the Church: Apostolic
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from June 23, 2024, Andy shares with us from Ephesians 2: 19-20. We see that the church is founded upon the teachings of the Apostles. That is what it means to be "Apostolic," to be part of that lineage. But what does that actually mean?

item.itunes:title: May 26, 2024 - Joint Service - Equations
item.title: May 26, 2024 - Joint Service - Equations
item.itunes:summary: In our combined worship service on May 26, 2024, Andy shares with us from Romans 5: 1-5. We talk today about the Trinity. While there is much we do not understand, over very salvation is a Trinitarian act. We are made right with the Father, through the Son, by the Spirit.

item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from Pentecost Sunday, Andy shares with us from Acts 2: 1-21 and Genesis 11: 1-9. God is a God of restoration. He restores all things. When we catch on fire with the Spirit, amazing things happen!

item.title: May 12, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Mother's Day
item.itunes:summary: On our INTERSECTION message from Mother's Day, Brian shares with us from John 17: 6-19. We are reminded that Jesus is with us and protects us in the same way that those who love us are always there with us

item.itunes:title: May 12, 2024 - Traditional - The Real World
item.title: May 12, 2024 - Traditional - The Real World
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from May 12, Andy shares with us from John 17: 6-19. Jesus doesn't pray that we be removed from suffering but that we will be protected. In the real world, we will find troubles. But, through His graces, these trials and grow us even closer to our Savior.

item.itunes:title: May 5, 2025 - Traditional - This I Believe
item.title: May 5, 2025 - Traditional - This I Believe
item.itunes:summary: The path we are walking as a church is challenging, but we believe it is the right path. The world needs to see what unity can look like. Just because we don't agree on everything doesn't mean we can't unite on the main thing.

item.title: April 28, 2024 - Baccalaureate Service - Leaving the Cave
item.itunes:summary: In our Baccalaureate Service from April 28, 2024, our Student Pastor, Mary Beth Davis-Ashley, shares with us from 1 Kings, 9: 1-13. For our seniors and all of us, how do we know when God is speaking? And we find that God may not be calling us exactly where we expect.

item.itunes:title: April 7, 2024 - Traditional - See the Beauty
item.title: April 7, 2024 - Traditional - See the Beauty
item.itunes:summary: In our April 7, 2024 sermon, Andy shares with us from John 20: 19-31. There is much to unpack and understand here. But in the end, we see here that we have a beautiful story, a story of grace, that the world needs to hear. But before the world can know it, we have to see it.

item.title: March 31, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Easter - The Empty Grave
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from Easter on March 31, 2024, we see the grave empty. In Mark 16: 1-8, we see the wonder and power of Easter!

item.itunes:title: March 31, 2024 - Traditional - Easter - Evidence of Things Unseen
item.title: March 31, 2024 - Traditional - Easter - Evidence of Things Unseen
item.itunes:summary: In our Easter message from our Traditional service, Andy shares with us from Mark 16: 1-8. Easter is the dividing point between the old and the next. We have to imagine who God has called us to be and live remembering who that is.

item.itunes:title: March 28, 20224 - Maundy Thursday - Humility and Hospitality
item.title: March 28, 20224 - Maundy Thursday - Humility and Hospitality
item.itunes:summary: In our Maundy Thursday service, Beth shares with us from John's Gospel, and we see the lengths that our Lord goes to provide His welcome and His grace, even on the edge of the coming storm. How great is His love for us!

item.itunes:title: March 24, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Palm Sunday
item.title: March 24, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Palm Sunday
item.itunes:summary: In our Palm Sunday Sermon, Brian shares with us from Mark 11: 1-11. We see Jesus enter joyfully into Jerusalem. This is the beginning of Holy Week, leading to the cross and then to the empty grave. What can we learn from this holy day?

item.itunes:title: March 24, 2024 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Fullfillment
item.title: March 24, 2024 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Fullfillment
item.itunes:summary: In our Palm Sunday message, Andy shares with us from Mark 11: 1-11. We see that Jesus fulfilled His purpose. He was always headed to Jerusalem. The people expected earthly answers. He was offering spiritual ones. It's the same for us today. Will we look for earthly answers to spiritual realities?
item.description: In our Palm Sunday message, Andy shares with us from Mark 11: 1-11.  We see that Jesus fulfilled His purpose. He was always headed to Jerusalem. The people expected earthly answers. He was offering spiritual ones.  It's the same for us today. Will we look for earthly answers to spiritual realities?

item.itunes:title: March 17, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against the Greatest Temptation
item.title: March 17, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against the Greatest Temptation
item.itunes:summary: Brian shares with us from John 12: 20-33, and we see our greatest temptation is to live only for ourselves!
item.description: Brian shares with us from John 12: 20-33, and we see our greatest temptation is to live only for ourselves!

item.itunes:title: March 17, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against the Greatest Temptation
item.title: March 17, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against the Greatest Temptation
item.itunes:summary: Today, in our Traditional service, Andy shares with us from John: 12 20-33. We see that we struggle with our greatest temptation - to make our lives completely about ourselves and not about God. To find life, we must die to ourselves.

item.itunes:title: March 10, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against the Dark
item.title: March 10, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against the Dark
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from March 10, 2024, we look at John 3: 14-21. We see that this is the judgment: We love dark more than light. We wrestle against the dark every day, with Jesus' light as our weapon.
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from March 10, 2024, we look at John 3: 14-21. We see that this is the judgment: We love dark more than light. We wrestle against the dark every day, with Jesus' light as our weapon.

item.itunes:title: March 10, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against the Dark
item.title: March 10, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against the Dark
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from March 10, 2024, we look at John 3: 14-21. We are told that people love darkness more than light. We wrestle against the dark, every day, the darkness that tries to pull us down. But, in truth, darkness can never overcome the light. We have nothing to fear; we stand in the light of Jesus!
item.description: In our Traditional message from March 10, 2024, we look at John 3: 14-21.  We are told that people love darkness more than light. We wrestle against the dark, every day, the darkness that tries to pull us down. But, in truth, darkness can never overcome the light. We have nothing to fear; we stand in the light of Jesus!

item.itunes:title: March 3, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against Pride
item.title: March 3, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against Pride
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from March 3, 2024, we look at Jesus cleansing the temple in John 2: 13-22. Jesus was faithful, no matter what others thought. For us to do the same, we must wrestle with our pride.

item.itunes:title: February 25, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against Ourselves
item.title: February 25, 2024 - INTERSECTION - We Wrestle Against Ourselves
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from February 25, 2024, we look at Mark 8: 31-38. We see Jesus tell Peter - get behind me, Satan! Sometimes the great things we must learn to fight are ourselves and our desire for control.
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from February 25, 2024, we look at Mark 8: 31-38. We see Jesus tell Peter - get behind me, Satan!  Sometimes the great things we must learn to fight are ourselves and our desire for control.

item.itunes:title: February 25, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against Ourselves
item.title: February 25, 2024 - Traditional - We Wrestle Against Ourselves
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from February 25, 2024, we look at Mark 8: 31-38. Peter has to learn this lesson; we all must learn. To get out of his own way. Sometimes, the hardest battle we must fight is with ourselves and our desire for control.

item.itunes:title: February 18, 2024 - Combined - We Wrestle Against Temptation
item.title: February 18, 2024 - Combined - We Wrestle Against Temptation
item.itunes:summary: In the February 18, 2024 message, we looked at Mark 1: 9-15. We are looking specifically at the temptation account. We expect spirited careful to be grand and glorious. But normally, it is the ordinary, common battle of putting our pride to death and following Jesus.

item.itunes:title: January 28, 2024 - Traditional - Balance: Tradition
item.title: January 28, 2024 - Traditional - Balance: Tradition
item.itunes:summary: In our Tradition service as part of our series "Balance," Beth shares with us from 2 Thessalonians 2: 13-15, where Paul speaks to us about the Tradition handed down. What does it mean to say to us as United Methodists that we use Tradition to better understand Scripture?

item.itunes:title: Balance: Tradition (Andy's message)
item.title: Balance: Tradition (Andy's message)
item.itunes:summary: Even though Andy was out on Sunday, we discussed Tradition in our series about theological reflection called "Balance," he wanted to share this message with you. He looks at 2 Thessalonians 2: 13-15, where Paul speaks to us about the Tradition handed down. What does it mean to say to us as United Methodists that we use Tradition to better understand Scripture? If you'd like to see Andy's notes, you can click here - https://docs.google.com/document/d/13liS0vNpBgflAjRiiM7sbh_lNj7zJSIK5NbLKjcvq...
item.description:
Even though Andy was out on Sunday, we discussed Tradition in our series about theological reflection called "Balance," he wanted to share this message with you. He looks at 2 Thessalonians 2: 13-15, where Paul speaks to us about the Tradition handed down. What does it mean to say to us as United Methodists that we use Tradition to better understand Scripture?

If you'd like to see Andy's notes, you can click here - https://docs.google.com/document/d/13liS0vNpBgflAjRiiM7sbh_lNj7zJSIK5NbLKjcvqG0/edit?usp=sharing
item.content:encoded:
Even though Andy was out on Sunday, we discussed Tradition in our series about theological reflection called "Balance," he wanted to share this message with you. He looks at 2 Thessalonians 2: 13-15, where Paul speaks to us about the Tradition handed down. What does it mean to say to us as United Methodists that we use Tradition to better understand Scripture?

If you'd like to see Andy's notes, you can click here - https://docs.google.com/document/d/13liS0vNpBgflAjRiiM7sbh_lNj7zJSIK5NbLKjcvqG0/edit?usp=sharing

item.itunes:title: January 21, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Balance: Scripiture
item.title: January 21, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Balance: Scripiture
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from January 21, 2024, Brian preaches from 2 Timothy 3: 16-17. This is part of our series "Balance" on how we United Methodists do theological reflection; we talk about our primary means of knowledge and truth - Scripture. Scripture is the foundation of everything we do, know, and believe. It is our source of all truth. In this message, we talk about the essential role that Scripture has in our faith!

item.itunes:title: January 14, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Balance
item.title: January 14, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Balance
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION sermon from January 14, 2024, Beth shares with us from Matthew 22: 24-40. Our method of theological reflection, as United Methodists, helps to make us balanced and faithful disciples of Jesus!

item.itunes:title: January 14, 2024 - Traditional - Balance
item.title: January 14, 2024 - Traditional - Balance
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from January 14, 2024, Andy shares with us from Matthew 22: 34-40. We begin talking about the beauty that is the way we do theological reflection in the United Methodist Church. Join us over the next few weeks as we talk about Scripture, Tradition, Experience, and Reason. Today, we talk about our method of reflection and how it helps to create balance in our lives and our faith.
item.description:
In our Traditional sermon from January 14, 2024, Andy shares with us from Matthew 22: 34-40.  We begin talking about the beauty that is the way we do theological reflection in the United Methodist Church.  Join us over the next few weeks as we talk about Scripture, Tradition, Experience, and Reason.  

Today, we talk about our method of reflection and how it helps to create balance in our lives and our faith.
item.content:encoded:
In our Traditional sermon from January 14, 2024, Andy shares with us from Matthew 22: 34-40.  We begin talking about the beauty that is the way we do theological reflection in the United Methodist Church.  Join us over the next few weeks as we talk about Scripture, Tradition, Experience, and Reason.  

Today, we talk about our method of reflection and how it helps to create balance in our lives and our faith.
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: January 7, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Road Trip
item.title: January 7, 2024 - INTERSECTION - Road Trip
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from January 7, 2024, Brian shares with us from Matthew 2: 1-12. We see the journey of the Wise Men. There is much we can learn about God's love from looking at their road trip.
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from January 7, 2024, Brian shares with us from Matthew 2: 1-12.  We see the journey of the Wise Men.  There is much we can learn about God's love from looking at their road trip.

item.itunes:title: January 7, 2024 - Traditional - The Long and Winding Road
item.title: January 7, 2024 - Traditional - The Long and Winding Road
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from January 7, 2024, Andy shares with us about the Wise Men from Matthew 2: 1-12. We see the journey they took; how it was often hard. Following after Jesus is not always easy. But when He is the north star that we follow, we find the life we seek.

item.itunes:title: December 31, 2023 - Combined - Pressing Ahead
item.title: December 31, 2023 - Combined - Pressing Ahead
item.itunes:summary: In our Combined worship service, Brian shares with us from Philippians 3:13-14. As we move into this New Year, we press ahead. Forgetting what is past, we move ahead, faithfully to what God is calling us to in 2024!

item.itunes:title: Christmas Eve - Good News
item.title: Christmas Eve - Good News
item.itunes:summary: In our Christmas Eve message, Andy shares with us from Luke 2: 1-20. The Gospel is Good News! For unto us a child is born! That is Good News! That is the Gospel. God responds to all our human brokenness and needs with Love!
item.description: In our Christmas Eve message, Andy shares with us from Luke 2: 1-20.  The Gospel is Good News!  For unto us a child is born!  That is Good News!  That is the Gospel. God responds to all our human brokenness and needs with Love!

item.itunes:title: December 24, 2023 - Combined Worship - Jesus is Love
item.title: December 24, 2023 - Combined Worship - Jesus is Love
item.itunes:summary: In our Combined worship service from December 24, 2023, Andy shares with us from Luke 1: 26-38. Jesus is love. But Mary had a part to play in God's plan of us knowing that. There are folks out there who need to know that God is love. We have a job to do in telling others this truth!

item.itunes:title: Blue Christmas - Sing Your Lament
item.title: Blue Christmas - Sing Your Lament
item.itunes:summary: In our Blue Christmas Service, Andy shares from Psalm 130 and Lamentations 3: 22-26. Lament is a Christian virtue. We wait upon the Lord. We hope in the Lord. But there are times when all we can do is lament our pain, our loss, our hurt. And know that our Lord is with us, in the midst of all of our hurt.

item.title: December 3, 2023 - Traditional - Jesus is Hope

item.itunes:title: November 19, 2023 - Traditional - All Good Things
item.title: November 19, 2023 - Traditional - All Good Things
item.itunes:summary: In our message from November 19, 2023, Andy shares with us from James 1:17. We are reminded that all good gifts are from above. If it is in your life and it is a good thing, it is from God. All of these gifts of grace, they point us to the love and salvation of our God. All good things point us to Jesus!

item.itunes:title: October 29, 2023 - INTERSECTION - We All Can Give
item.title: October 29, 2023 - INTERSECTION - We All Can Give
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from October 29, 2023, we hear the story of the widow with Elijah. It looked like she had nothing more to give. We find, however, that when she gave, even when it was a challenge, she found more life than she could have ever expected!

item.itunes:title: October 29, 2023 - Traditional - Blood from a Turnip
item.title: October 29, 2023 - Traditional - Blood from a Turnip
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from October 29, 2023, we hear the story of the widow and Elijah. She had given all that she could give, and now Elijah wanted more? You can't get blood from a turnip. But when we look closer, we see that her call to give was actually her call to live. When we give, we actually find life.

item.itunes:title: September 17, 2023 - Traditional - Morning by Morning
item.title: September 17, 2023 - Traditional - Morning by Morning
item.itunes:summary: We don't like death. Or sickness. Or pain. We hide from these things. We do them in private. But this has been a hard season for our church. And today, we stop, and we lament. For us to heal, we have to sit with our pain and name our pain. We lament what we have been through and what we have lost. We lament the pain and the hurt. But we also have hope. Morning by morning, new mercies we see! We are going to build something beautiful here at St. Matth...
item.description:
We don't like death.  Or sickness.  Or pain. We hide from these things. We do them in private. But this has been a hard season for our church. And today, we stop, and we lament. For us to heal, we have to sit with our pain and name our pain.  We lament what we have been through and what we have lost.  We lament the pain and the hurt. 

But we also have hope.  Morning by morning, new mercies we see!  We are going to build something beautiful here at St. Matthew's.   For the glory and beauty of God. We've had pain and loss, yes. But we have hope. Because God is good!  And His mercies are always, there!
item.content:encoded:
We don't like death.  Or sickness.  Or pain. We hide from these things. We do them in private. But this has been a hard season for our church. And today, we stop, and we lament. For us to heal, we have to sit with our pain and name our pain.  We lament what we have been through and what we have lost.  We lament the pain and the hurt. 

But we also have hope.  Morning by morning, new mercies we see!  We are going to build something beautiful here at St. Matthew's.   For the glory and beauty of God. We've had pain and loss, yes. But we have hope. Because God is good!  And His mercies are always, there!
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: September 3, 2023 - Joint Service - Here I Am
item.title: September 3, 2023 - Joint Service - Here I Am
item.itunes:summary: In our Joint service from September 3, 2023, Andy shares with us from Exodus 3: 1-15. We see God call to Moses from the burning bush. Fire in scripture often points to purification. God called Moses, purified him, and used him. Our tests and trials purify us, and God wants to use them, and all things, for something beautiful.
item.description: In our Joint service from September 3, 2023, Andy shares with us from Exodus 3: 1-15. We see God call to Moses from the burning bush.  Fire in scripture often points to purification.  God called Moses, purified him, and used him. Our tests and trials purify us, and God wants to use them, and all things, for something beautiful.

We see God call to Moses from the burning bush.  Fire in scripture often points to purification.  God called Moses, purified him, and used him. Our tests and trials purify us, and God wants to use them, and all things, for something beautiful.

item.title: August 20, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Faith
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from August 20, 2023, Brian preaches from Matthew 15: 21-28. We see a mother in great need, yet she still has faith. We too, we can have faith even in the challenging moments of life.

item.itunes:title: August 6, 2023 - INTERSECTION - The Feeding of the 5,000
item.title: August 6, 2023 - INTERSECTION - The Feeding of the 5,000
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message, Brian looks at Matthew 14: 13-21. Here we see the feeding of the 5,000. In this, we see that no matter how challenging it may seem, Jesus will always be able to make a way!

item.itunes:title: August 6, 2023 - Traditional - You Do It
item.title: August 6, 2023 - Traditional - You Do It
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message, Andy shares with us from Matthew 14: 13-21. We see Jesus give the disciples a problem they could not fix - feeding the 5,000. He tells them, you do it. But the way they solve the problem is not their own strength, but they take them to Jesus. It is not for us to figure out; it is for us to follow His lead.

item.itunes:title: July 30, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - The Family of God
item.title: July 30, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - The Family of God
item.itunes:summary: We finish up our Relationship Roadmap series by looking at John 15: 9-17. We look at what Jesus tells us - He chose us. He is for us. He loves us. And if He loves us, then we are called to love each other.

item.itunes:title: June 23, 2033 - INTERSECTION- Relationaship Roadmap- Outsiders
item.title: June 23, 2033 - INTERSECTION- Relationaship Roadmap- Outsiders
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from June 23, 2023, Andy shares with us from Romans 12: 9-21. Paul talks about heaping burning coals upon the heads of our enemies. We look deeper at what the Bible says about coals, the Gospel, and holiness. What exactly is Paul calling us to in this text?

item.itunes:title: July 16, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Relationship Roadmap - Other Relationships
item.title: July 16, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Relationship Roadmap - Other Relationships
item.itunes:summary: In our July 16 INTERSECTION message, Brian shares with us about the key relationships in our lives, our friendships and other vital relationships. God made us from this, and these relationships are one of His great gifts to us!

item.itunes:title: July 16, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Other Relationships
item.title: July 16, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Other Relationships
item.itunes:summary: In our July 16 message, Andy shares with us from Ephesians 6: 5-9. This passage starts off talking about slavery, so we take a few moments to unpack to interpret scripture, particularly hard passages. After that, we look at what Paul is telling us about the other key relationships in our lives, especially our need for friendships.

item.itunes:title: July 9, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Relationship Roadmap - Parents
item.title: July 9, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Relationship Roadmap - Parents
item.itunes:summary: In our Relationship Roadmap series, Brian shares with us from Ephesians 6: 4. What does Paul have to say to us today regarding how we should love, discipline, and teach our children?
item.description: In our Relationship Roadmap series, Brian shares with us from Ephesians 6: 4. What does Paul have to say to us today regarding how we should love, discipline, and teach our children?

item.itunes:title: July 9, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Parents
item.title: July 9, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Parents
item.itunes:summary: In our Relationship Roadmap series, we look today at what Paul has to say about what it means to be a parent. To love our children and not provoke them. How do we love? How do we discipline? It all starts with being rooted in Christ. And at the end of the message, Andy shares a few words to St. Matthew's about how we live together during pain, hurt, anger, and discernment.
item.description:
In our Relationship Roadmap series, we look today at what Paul has to say about what it means to be a parent. To love our children and not provoke them. How do we love?  How do we discipline?  It all starts with being rooted in Christ. 

And at the end of the message, Andy shares a few words to St. Matthew's about how we live together during pain, hurt, anger, and discernment.
item.content:encoded:
In our Relationship Roadmap series, we look today at what Paul has to say about what it means to be a parent. To love our children and not provoke them. How do we love?  How do we discipline?  It all starts with being rooted in Christ. 

And at the end of the message, Andy shares a few words to St. Matthew's about how we live together during pain, hurt, anger, and discernment.
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: June 25, 2023 - Traditioal - Relationship Roadmap - Children
item.title: June 25, 2023 - Traditioal - Relationship Roadmap - Children
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from June 25, 2023, Brian shares with us from Ephesians 6: 1-3. We see here God's word for children in how they are called to obey their parents. We see in these passages God's plan for our families!

item.title: June 25, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Relationship Roadmap - Children
item.itunes:summary: In our series Relationship Roadmap, Andy shares from Ephesians 6: 1-3. Children are told to obey their parents. Just as wives submit, husbands lay down, and children obey. All members of the family are called to submit themselves to the mission and good of the family.

item.title: June 18, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Wives and Husbands
item.itunes:summary: In our Relationship Roadmap series, Brian preaches from Ephesians 5: 21-33. In this passage, we see Paul's words to us, for us to mutually submit to one another, in this we follow the way of Christ!

item.itunes:title: June 18, 2023 - Traditional - Husbands
item.title: June 18, 2023 - Traditional - Husbands
item.itunes:summary: In our June 18 Traditional sermon, Andy shares with us from Ephesians 5: 25-33. In this passage, we see that husbands are commanded to love their wives as Christ loves the church. As husbands and wives both mutually submit for the good of the marriage, we see the power of Christ in our families!

item.title: June 11, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Healing
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from June 11, 2023, our guest preacher, Rev. Dr. Embra Jackson, shares with us about the healing and restoration that our loving God longs to share with us. Take a few moments to listen to this encouraging word!

item.itunes:title: June 11, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Wives
item.title: June 11, 2023 - Traditional - Relationship Roadmap - Wives
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from June 11, Andy shares with us from challenging verses, Ephesians 5: 21-24. Wives submit to your husbands. These words have been used for great harm by many people. But when we take a look at the broader context of scripture, we see what Paul is saying not just to wives but to all believers.

item.itunes:title: May 28, 2023 - INTERSECTION - God is an Artist
item.title: May 28, 2023 - INTERSECTION - God is an Artist
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from Pentecost, 2023, Andy shares with us from Acts 2: 1-21. We see that in Pentecost that God is a painting us a picture of what He longs to do. He longs to restore and rebuild. He will restore all that sin has taken. The Holy Spirit will restore and will bring new life.

He longs to restore and rebuild.  He will restore all that sin has taken.  The Holy Spirit will restore and will bring new life.

item.itunes:title: May 28, 2023 - Traditional - Something New
item.title: May 28, 2023 - Traditional - Something New
item.itunes:summary: In our Pentecost Sunday message Brian shares with us from Acts 2: 1-21. The Holy Spirit calls us outside the walls of our church and to something new. It may be scary for us, but we can always trust that God is with us.

item.itunes:title: May 21, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Cast Your Cares
item.title: May 21, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Cast Your Cares
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from May 21, Brian shares with us from 1 Peter 5: 6-11. We can cast our cares and anxieties on Jesus, because He cares for us!

item.itunes:title: May 21, 2023 - Traditional - Anxiety
item.title: May 21, 2023 - Traditional - Anxiety
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from May 21, Andy shares with us from 1 Peter 5: 6-11. We are to cast our anxieties on Christ, because He cares for us. But, we struggle. We worry. What should we do with our worries and fears? Cast them to Jesus!

item.itunes:title: May 14, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Through You
item.title: May 14, 2023 - INTERSECTION - Through You
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service from May 14, Brian shares with us from John 14: 23-29. Through Jesus, we see God's goodness and mercy, we see God's love. And through us, all the world can know that love.

item.itunes:title: May 14, 2023 - Traditional - Birthmarks
item.title: May 14, 2023 - Traditional - Birthmarks
item.itunes:summary: In our Sunday sermon from May 14, 2023, Andy shares with us from John 14: 23-29. Love is what holds our families together. Love is our birthmark from God, God's love for us, and the love we have for others, it's how others know that we are His.

item.title: May 7, 2023 - Traditional - Identity
item.itunes:summary: In on our Traditional message from May 7, 2023, Andy shares with us from 1 Peter 2: 2-10. We see in this passage where our identity is found. But do we live in the truth of who we are in Jesus? Do we live in His grace as our primary identity?
