item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from April 30, 2023, Brian shares with us from John 10: 1-10. Jesus is the good shepherd, where we receive life. How can we better listen for His voice?

item.itunes:title: April 30, 2023 - Traditional - Life
item.title: April 30, 2023 - Traditional - Life
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from April 30, 2023 Andy shares with us his favorite verse - John 10:10. Jesus came to give us abundant life. That is what the world needs now, joyous abundant life. We only find that voice, through, by listening to the voice of the good shepherd.

item.itunes:title: April 16, 2023 - Traditional - Signs and Wonders
item.title: April 16, 2023 - Traditional - Signs and Wonders
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from Sunday, April 16, Andy shares with us from John 20: 19-31. We see that so many people in the text did not believe until they had experienced. We are the same way. We need to experience Jesus' goodness. And then help others to do just the same.

item.itunes:title: April 9, 2023 - Easter - Traditional - All Shall Be Well
item.title: April 9, 2023 - Easter - Traditional - All Shall Be Well
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional Easter Sermon, Andy shares with us from Matthew 28: 1-10. In this message he share with us how God is playing the long game to defeat sin, death and the grave. The devil longs to trick us to sit in the darkness with Him. But God calls us into the light!

item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION service, Brian shares with us from Matthew 21: 1-11. In this passage we see Jesus enter into Jerusalem, and this crowd worshiped. Later in the week, they will chant crucify Him. How can we avoid that mistake?

item.itunes:title: April 2, 2023 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Two Crowds
item.title: April 2, 2023 - Palm Sunday - Traditional - Two Crowds
item.itunes:summary: In our Palm Sunday message from our Traditional Service, Andy shares with us from Matthew 21: 1-11. We see the crowd was looking for an earthly king, a "son of David." Jesus promised a heavenly kingdom, not of this world. They were disappointed, so they changed their cries to crucify. What do we do with our disappointment?

item.itunes:title: Ash Wednesday - Which Prayer will we Pray?
item.title: Ash Wednesday - Which Prayer will we Pray?
item.itunes:summary: In our Ash Wednesday Service, we look at Matthew 6, and also Luke 18: 9-14. We need Lent, now more than ever. This year, we can pray one of two prayers, "Lord, fix them, they are the problem" or "Lord, have mercy on me, a sinner." Which prayer will we pray?

item.title: January 8, 2023 - Traditional - On Purpose
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from January 8, 2023, we look at Matthew 2: 1-12. In this passage, we look deeper at the Wise Men. What we find is this, the Wise Men were purposeful in their seeking of Jesus. How will we do the same this year?

item.title: December 18, 2022 - Blue Christmas - Questions

item.title: December 11, 2022 - Traditional - Waiting is Mercy
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional service message from December 11, 2022, we read from 2 Peter 3: 9-12. Waiting is part of our faith; part of our life. We find in scripture that waiting is not wasted, waiting is a mercy, it is a chance to live fully another day.

item.title: October 2, 2022 - Traditional - How Stuff Works
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from October 2, 2022 Andy shares with us from Acts 6: 1-7. How does church work? How do all these things fit together? How does it all happen. We find out, there is no magic church fairy, it's just you, me, and the Holy Spirit!

item.itunes:title: September 25, 2022 - Traditional - The Prodigal Son
item.title: September 25, 2022 - Traditional - The Prodigal Son
item.itunes:summary: This should actually be thought of as the Lost Brothers. We see two brothers today, lost in sin. One in the sin of lack of righteousness, one in the sin of self righteousness. To both of these brothers, the Father came running with grace. No matter where we find ourselves, may we know the Father's deep love.

item.itunes:title: September 18, 2022 - Traditional - Esther
item.title: September 18, 2022 - Traditional - Esther
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from September 18, 2022, Andy shares with us from Esther 4. This passage is very much where we can find ourselves. We are comfortable, all is well. Jackson, or Memphis' problems are of no concern to us. Yet, just like Esther, we are called to look beyond our comfort to the needs that, in truth, do affect us.

But the miracle is not exactly what you think it is. And like a Marvel movie, stay after the prayer for an additional mini sermon from Andy about Mary and Martha.

But the miracle is not exactly what you think it is. And like a Marvel movie, stay after the prayer for an additional mini sermon from Andy about Mary and Martha.
item.content:encoded: In our Traditional message from August 14, 2022, Andy shares with us from Matthew 14: 13-21.  In this passage we see Jesus feed the 5,000. But the miracle is not exactly what you think it is. And like a Marvel movie, stay after the prayer for an additional mini sermon from Andy about Mary and Martha.

item.itunes:title: July 10, 2022 - Traditional - Opposition
item.title: July 10, 2022 - Traditional - Opposition
item.itunes:summary: In our message from July 10, 2022, we look at passages in Nehemiah that show us this. Being faithful, rebuilding the wall is not always easy, in fact, more often than not we will face opposition. Internal opposition and external opposition. But being faithful is always worth it.

item.itunes:title: June 26, 2022 - Traditional - Repair the Wall
item.title: June 26, 2022 - Traditional - Repair the Wall
item.itunes:summary: In Nehemiah 2: 11-20, we look at Nehemiah taking and honest inspection of the wall. It was in bad shape. It needed to be rebuilt. Until we know where we are and where we stand, we can't fully rebuilt. But we want to make sure we rebuilt to be who God is calling us to be, not rebuilding on nostalgia and what we used to be.
item.description: In Nehemiah 2: 11-20, we look at Nehemiah taking and honest inspection of the wall.  It was in bad shape. It needed to be rebuilt.  Until we know where we are and where we stand, we can't fully rebuilt.  But we want to make sure we rebuilt to be who God is calling us to be, not rebuilding on nostalgia and what we used to be.

It needed to be rebuilt.  Until we know where we are and where we stand, we can't fully rebuilt.  But we want to make sure we rebuilt to be who God is calling us to be, not rebuilding on nostalgia and what we used to be.
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: June 19, 2022 - Traditional - Remember Your People
item.title: June 19, 2022 - Traditional - Remember Your People
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from June 19 we look at Nehemiah 2: 1-8. Today we see that Nehemiah is motivated to rebuild the wall because he remembers his people. As we rebuild, we need to remember the importance of our community here, remember our mission, and remember how much we love each other.

item.itunes:title: June 12, 2022 - Traditional - Rebuild
item.title: June 12, 2022 - Traditional - Rebuild
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional sermon from June 12, Andy shares from Nehemiah 1: 1-11. We look at what happened after the exile to Jerusalem. The wall needed to be rebuilt. It took everyone. Post COVID, we need to rebuild. We are a different church now than we were before. To rebuild, it will take all of us. Will you be a part?
item.description: In our Traditional sermon from June 12, Andy shares from Nehemiah 1: 1-11.  We look at what happened after the exile to Jerusalem. The wall needed to be rebuilt.  It took everyone. Post COVID, we need to rebuild. We are a different church now than we were before.  To rebuild, it will take all of us. Will you be a part?

item.itunes:title: May 29, 2022 - Traditional - One
item.title: May 29, 2022 - Traditional - One
item.itunes:summary: In John 17: 20-26, we see Jesus pray that the church may be one. We don't often think about unity as an important virtue of the church, but we see how important it was to Jesus today. What does it mean to have unity, and how is that something we can do?

item.itunes:title: October 17, 2021 - INTERSECTION - Forward in Unity
item.title: October 17, 2021 - INTERSECTION - Forward in Unity
item.itunes:summary: In our INTERSECTION message from October 17, 2021, Andy shares with us from Joshua 6: 12-16. To win the battle of Jericho, everyone had to do us their abilities together, no gift was greater. Together in unity, great things were accomplished. It is the same for us today as the church. How do we use our gifts for God's glory?
item.description: In our INTERSECTION message from October 17, 2021, Andy shares with us from Joshua 6: 12-16.  To win the battle of Jericho, everyone had to do us their abilities together, no gift was greater.  Together in unity, great things were accomplished.  It is the same for us today as the church.  How do we use our gifts for God's glory?

item.title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - The Cross
item.itunes:summary: In our Bible Study, we look at God's response to the fall and to sin. We see that the cross was His answer and it changed everything. We study Isaiah 53 tonight, seeing what Jesus has done for us.

item.itunes:title: Easter Sunday - Traditional Sermon - After the Rising
item.title: Easter Sunday - Traditional Sermon - After the Rising
item.itunes:summary: In our sermon from our Easter Traditional Service, Andy look at John 20: 1-23. Nothing was the same after the resurrection. Nothing could be back to normal. What does it mean for us to think about going back to normal? Do we want to do that? Or is there a better way?
item.description: In  our sermon from our Easter Traditional Service, Andy look at John 20: 1-23.  Nothing was the same after the resurrection.  Nothing could be back to normal. What does it mean for us to think about going back to normal?  Do we want to do that?  Or is there a better way?
item.content:encoded: In  our sermon from our Easter Traditional Service, Andy look at John 20: 1-23.  Nothing was the same after the resurrection.  Nothing could be back to normal. What does it mean for us to think about going back to normal?  Do we want to do that?  Or is there a better way?
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: March 28, 2021 - Traditional Service - Made Whole and Restored
item.title: March 28, 2021 - Traditional Service - Made Whole and Restored
item.itunes:summary: In the last sermon in our series on the Apostles' Creed, we look at the forgiveness of sins, resurrection of the body, and the life everlasting. Forgiveness is as much an essential part of the Christian faith as is the Trinity and the Resurrection. In the end, we will be made whole and restored.
item.description: In the last sermon in our series on the Apostles' Creed, we look at the forgiveness of sins, resurrection of the body, and the life everlasting.  Forgiveness is as much an essential part of the Christian faith as is the Trinity and the Resurrection.  In the end, we will be made whole and restored.

item.itunes:title: March 21, 2021 - Traditional Service - Spirit and Body
item.title: March 21, 2021 - Traditional Service - Spirit and Body
item.itunes:summary: In our message from March 21, Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 12: 21-27. Today we continue looking at the Apostles' Creed and we focus on the Holy Spirit. We see the role the Spirit plays in the Trinity, our salvation, and the Church, which is open to persons of all races and nations. Racism has no place in Christ's Church.

item.itunes:title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - Why Not to Fast
item.title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - Why Not to Fast
item.itunes:summary: In our Wednesday Night Bible Study, Andy looks at different passages and shows us the wrong motivations for fasting. It is not about making us look good for other people or even to impress God. It is an avenue God has given us to grow closer to Him and know Him better!

item.title: January 24, 2021 - Traditional Service - The Big Ask
item.itunes:summary: We continue with our series on the Lord's Prayer, in Matthew 6: 9-13. This week Andy looks at verse 10, "Thy Kingdom Come, Thy Will be Done on Earth as it is in Heaven." When we think about what we are asking God to do here, that is a HUGE deal. What would the world look like if this happened?

item.title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - Evangelism - Your Testimony

item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from Sunday, January 10, 2021, it is Baptism of the Lord Sunday. We read from Mark 1: 1-11. We see how for Jesus His baptism wasn't the end of His journey, but the beginning. The same is true for us!

item.title: January 3, 2021 - Traditional Service - Seeking
item.itunes:summary: In our Epiphany Sunday message, Andy looks at Matthew 2: 1-12. We see the Wise Men come and worship Jesus. What can the dangers of their journey teach us about ours?

item.title: December 27, 2020 - Traditional Service - Needle in a Haystack
item.itunes:summary: In our message from December 27, 2020, Andy looks at Luke 2: 21-40. In this passage we see Simeon and Anna, they had looked for the Messiah for years. They finally see Him. Today, do we have eyes to see what God is doing?

item.itunes:title: December 24, 2020 - Christmas Eve - Prince of Peace
item.title: December 24, 2020 - Christmas Eve - Prince of Peace
item.itunes:summary: In our Christmas Eve message, Andy shares with us about the Prince of Peace. We seem to have no peace in our world. Peace will only come through a relationship with Jesus Christ. He is our peace. When we know that, we can live out His peace each day.
item.description: In our Christmas Eve message, Andy shares with us about the Prince of Peace.  We seem to have no peace in our world.  Peace will only come through a relationship with Jesus Christ.  He is our peace.  When we know that, we can live out His peace each day.

item.title: December 20, 2020 - Traditional Service - In His Name
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional Sunday sermon we look at Luke 4: 16-21. In this passage we see Jesus give His first sermon and we see that it is a message shows use what life will look like if we lived out the Good News in His name.

item.itunes:title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - The Four Christmas Stories
item.title: Wednesday Night Bible Study - The Four Christmas Stories
item.itunes:summary: In our Wednesday Bible study for December 9, 2020, we look in depth at each of the four Gospels and the Christmas Stories as presented within in each one. How does each Gospel show us something a little different about the birth of our Savior? You may be surprised by what we find.

item.itunes:title: December 6, 2020 - Traditional Service - A Thrill of Hope

item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional Service message from December 6, 2020, Andy shares from Luke 1: 46-56, the Magnificat. As we read Mary's beautiful song of praise, we learn much about how God uses unexpected heroes to do amazing things for His kingdom!

item.itunes:title: September 27, 2020 - Traditional Service - Not Worthy
item.title: September 27, 2020 - Traditional Service - Not Worthy
item.itunes:summary: In our Sunday sermon, Andy preaches from Judges 2: 11-23 and Hebrews 11: 32-40. In this message we talk about how some are faithful are well known, but most aren't. What matters above all is this, are we faithful! If we are faithful, God takes care of the rest.

item.title: September 6, 2020 - Traditional - All Things
item.itunes:summary: In our Traditional message from Sunday, September 6, 2020, Andy shares with us from Genesis 50: 15-21. In this passage, we look at how God used all the things that happened in Joseph's life to bring him to a place to save his people. God uses all things for good. And if you've never heard Andy's testimony, he shares at the end.

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - May 17, 2020 - On Our Side
item.title: Traditional Service - May 17, 2020 - On Our Side
item.itunes:summary: In our sermon from May 17, Andy preaches from Acts 1:6-11. When Jesus ascended He went to the right hand of the Father, where now He is praying for us and giving us the support that we need. We should do the same. We should pray for each other and we must be there for each other. Let's pray for and love one another.
item.description: In our sermon from May 17, Andy preaches from Acts 1:6-11. item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - May 10, 2020 - The Center of the Gospel
item.title: Traditional Service - May 10, 2020 - The Center of the Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 15: 1-11. In Corinth, Paul took every dispute they had back to the Gospel. And what is at the center of the Gospel? The resurrection. Today, how do we see our families, our relationships, and even our economic stress through the Gospel? How do we see these things in light of the resurrection?
item.description: Andy shares with us from 1 Corinthians 15: 1-11.  In Corinth, Paul took every dispute they had back to the Gospel.  And what is at the center of the Gospel?  The resurrection. Today, how do we see our families, our relationships, and even our economic stress through the Gospel?  How do we see these things in light of the resurrection?

Today, how do we see our families, our relationships, and even our economic stress through the Gospel?  How do we see these things in light of the resurrection?

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - May 3, 2020 - Peter by the Lake
item.title: Traditional Service - May 3, 2020 - Peter by the Lake
item.itunes:summary: In our May 3 message, Andy preaches from John 21: 15-19. Peter thought he had failed beyond Jesus' ability to redeem. He thought he had done too much. He hadn't. Jesus loved him and restored him. Just as He will for us today.
item.description: In our May 3 message, Andy preaches from John 21: 15-19.  Peter thought he had failed beyond Jesus' ability to redeem.  He thought he had done too much.  He hadn't.  Jesus loved him and restored him.  Just as He will for us today.

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - April 26, 2020 - Walking to Emmaus
item.title: Traditional Service - April 26, 2020 - Walking to Emmaus
item.itunes:summary: In our message from April 26, Andy reads from Luke 24: 13-35. We see Jesus encounter disciples on the road to Emmaus. They didn't see Him for who He was, they were prevented. Jesus used Scripture and the Meal to show them (and us) Himself. May we see Him in the word and in the sacraments today and each day.
item.description: In our message from April 26, Andy reads from Luke 24: 13-35.  We see Jesus encounter disciples on the road to Emmaus. They didn't see Him for who He was, they were prevented. Jesus used Scripture and the Meal to show them (and us) Himself. May we see Him in the word and in the sacraments today and each day.

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - April 19, 2020 - Adusting to the Dark
item.title: Traditional Service - April 19, 2020 - Adusting to the Dark
item.itunes:summary: In our message from April 19, Andy preaches from John 20: 24-31. We see Thomas adjusting the reality of the cross. Others clung to hope, but he knew Jesus was dead. How could he hope? Be careful that we don't grow too used to the darkness of this moment. Light and life always win.
item.description: In our message from April 19, Andy preaches from John 20: 24-31.  We see Thomas adjusting the reality of the cross. Others clung to hope, but he knew Jesus was dead.  How could he hope?  Be careful that we don't grow too used to the darkness of this moment.  Light and life always win.

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - Easter- April 12, 2020 - The Rising
item.title: Traditional Service - Easter- April 12, 2020 - The Rising
item.itunes:summary: In our Easter message, Andy preaches from Matthew 28: 1-10. Jesus rose from the dead. He overcame. But for Him to overcome, there must have been something for him to overcome. The cross was real. But so is resurrection. Come on up for the rising.
item.description: In our Easter message, Andy preaches from Matthew 28: 1-10.  Jesus rose from the dead.  He overcame. But for Him to overcome, there must have been something for him to overcome. The cross was real.  But so is resurrection.  Come on up for the rising.

item.itunes:title: Traditional Service - Palm Sunday - April 5, 2020 - Truck Stop Faith
item.title: Traditional Service - Palm Sunday - April 5, 2020 - Truck Stop Faith
item.itunes:summary: In our Palm Sunday message, April 5, And shares with Matthew 21: 1-11. There are difficult times in our lives. Really challenges. We know it. But don't rush into those times. Look for moments of grace, ever day.

item.itunes:title: Maundy Thursday - The Look
item.title: Maundy Thursday - The Look
item.itunes:summary: In our Maundy Thursday sermon, Andy shares with us about the look that Jesus gave Peter after he denied Him. It was a look of love, but Jesus knew the depth of Peter's sin. And Peter knew that Jesus knew. Jesus loves us. But He also knows our sin.

item.itunes:title: Take Root Moments
item.title: Take Root Moments
item.itunes:summary: One of the things that we've done within our Take Root Series here at St. Matthew's is that we've had different speakers give a testimony about how the Gospel has taken root in their lives and how St. Matthew's has helped that seed to grow. In this podcast, you will hear from McKenna Baker, John Woods, Lilly Hobdy, Gardner Gallaspy, Ryan (and Reed) Plotner, Rocky Ruello, Daniel and Abbey Wright, Jeanne Halliwell, and Rusty Healy. Listen to these individuals, and you will be blessed and insp...
item.description: One of the things that we've done within our Take Root Series here at St. Matthew's is that we've had different speakers give a testimony about how the Gospel has taken root in their lives and how St. Matthew's has helped that seed to grow. In this podcast, you will hear from McKenna Baker, John Woods, Lilly Hobdy, Gardner Gallaspy, Ryan (and Reed) Plotner, Rocky Ruello, Daniel and Abbey Wright, Jeanne Halliwell, and Rusty Healy. Listen to these individuals, and you will be blessed and inspired about how the Gospel has taken root in their lives.
item.content:encoded: One of the things that we've done within our Take Root Series here at St. Matthew's is that we've had different speakers give a testimony about how the Gospel has taken root in their lives and how St. Matthew's has helped that seed to grow. In this podcast, you will hear from McKenna Baker, John Woods, Lilly Hobdy, Gardner Gallaspy, Ryan (and Reed) Plotner, Rocky Ruello, Daniel and Abbey Wright, Jeanne Halliwell, and Rusty Healy. Listen to these individuals, and you will be blessed and inspired about how the Gospel has taken root in their lives.
item.itunes:author: St. Matthew's UMC
